channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-22244] Added default ACLs for znodes on a non-kerberized cluster
item.description: Set default ACLs for znodes on a non-kerberized cluster: Create/Read/Delete/Write/Admin to the world
item.summary: Added default ACLs for znodes on a non-kerberized cluster

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
This is a delegation token store, so the unauthenticated user part looks suspicious.

Is there a scenario for this patch?
Can you provide more details on why this change is required? Making token store znode world-readable seems bad as it stores sensitive data.
Removed world-readable access for secure use-case (was added by mistake). However, when Zookeeper doesn't have security enabled (DWX use-case) and rest is kerberized, we need to have fallback.

-1 overall
